title: D-Day for Onsite Rental
text:
Bank of America and Macquarie Capital haven't given up on national equipment rental company Onsite Rental's initial public offering just yet.

Street Talk understands Onsite Rental's board will convene on Monday morning to decide whether to push ahead with the institutional bookbuild also scheduled for Monday.

Onsite Rental's board is scheduled to meet early Monday morning to decide whether to push ahead with an initial public offering. Peter Braig

And as of Sunday night, the two brokers were telling fund managers that the IPO to raise up to $253 million had not been pulled.

Blind Freddie could tell you it is extremely difficult for IPO contenders.

Five have been pulled in the past two weeks, including some businesses most would have thought were more ready for the ASX boards than Onsite.
description: Bank of America and Macquarie Capital haven't given up on national equipment rental company Onsite Rental's IPO.
